cip.render.util3d

Class Quadric3fIntersection

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.util3d.Quadric3fIntersection

  • public class Quadric3fIntersection
extends java.lang.Object
    The quadric intersection describes the results of a quadric intersection test. For any quadric there are either two, one, or no intersections for a given ray. The intersection test provides a code that characterizes the ray as either a non-intersecting ray or an intersecting ray. For a non-intersecting ray, the ray is either fully outside the quadic or fully inside the quadic. For an intersecting ray, the two intersection distances are given and the first intersection (the one with the least distance) is clasified as a going in or a going out. In the case of a single intersection, it is reported as the first intersection distance and the second intersection distance is set to Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY.

    From this information we can deduce the whether the point is inside (first intersection ray going in, dist 1 negative, dist 2 positive; or first intersection ray going out, dist 1 is positive or dist 2 is negative) or outside (first intersection ray going out, dist 1 negative, dist 2 positive; or first intersection ray going in and, dist 1 is positive or dist 2 is negative).

    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GOING_INTO
      The first intersection (at distance m_fDist1) is going into the quadric.
      static int GOING_OUT_OF
      The first intersection (at distance m_fDist1) is going out of the quadric.
      float m_fDist1
      The smallest distance to the intersection (the first intersection for an infinite directed line) from the origin of the ray if the code is GOING_INTO or GOING_OUT_OF.
      float m_fDist2
      The largest distance to the intersection (the second intersection for an infinite directed line) from the origin of the ray if the code is GOING_INTO or GOING_OUT_OF.
      int m_nCode
      The code describing the type of intersection.
      Quadric3fIntersection m_next
      A pointer to tne next Quadric3fIntersection in a cache if this object is cached.
      static int NONE_INSIDE
      The code for no intersection with the quadric and the ray being inside the quadric.
      static int NONE_OUTSIDE
      The code for no intersection with the quadric and the ray being outside the quadric.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • m_fDist1

        public float m_fDist1
        The smallest distance to the intersection (the first intersection for an infinite directed line) from the origin of the ray if the code is GOING_INTO or GOING_OUT_OF. Otherwise, this field is meaningless. NOTE: if the distance is negative, it means the intersection is effectively behind the start of the ray.

      • m_fDist2

        public float m_fDist2
        The largest distance to the intersection (the second intersection for an infinite directed line) from the origin of the ray if the code is GOING_INTO or GOING_OUT_OF. Otherwise, this field is meaningless. NOTE: if the distance is negative, it means the intersection is effectively behind the start of the ray. Also, if the distance is infinite, it means there was only one root (a wierd case for specific quadics like cones where the ray is parallel to the cone surface and there is only one intersection).

      • m_nCode

        public int m_nCode
        The code describing the type of intersection.
